  "description": "Oya Abeo is a sustainable, vacation-friendly textile brand blending West African artistry with modern design. We create hand-dyed and hand-stamped garments and home textiles, working closely with artisans in Nigeria. Our mission is to preserve culture, empower artisans, and make ethically made textiles accessible to the modern creative woman.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive &amp; Operations Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

About the Role


	We are seeking a highly organized, proactive, and adaptable assistant who thrives in creative environments, anticipates needs before they arise, and can seamlessly support both the founder&rsquo;s personal and professional life.


Role Overview


	This role combines personal assistance, operations support, content coordination, and customer care.
	You will be the right hand of the founder, ensuring that the studio, brand operations, content schedule, and daily priorities run smoothly without constant oversight.
	This is not a task-based assistant role &mdash; we need someone who thinks ahead, solves problems, and keeps the founder focused on creative and strategic priorities.


Key Responsibilities
Customer Service &amp; Brand Support:


	Manage all incoming customer communications (email, WhatsApp, Instagram DMs) with professionalism and brand-aligned tone.
	Track orders, follow up on deliveries, manage replacements, and handle customer concerns independently.
	Maintain records of recurring issues and provide weekly reports on customer feedback trends.


Content &amp; Digital Coordination:


	Help format and upload written and visual content.
	Assist with maintaining a content calendar and ensure all materials are polished and visually appealing.
	Collaborate with the marketing/content team for assets as needed.


Content Creation and Support Personal and Lifestyle Support:


	Shoot photos and videos at the office and studio, including artisan processes and behind-the-scenes content.
	Maintain content library and organize files for easy access by the marketing team.
	Track lighting, batteries, and storage supplies to ensure smooth content production.


Personal and Lifestyle Support:


	Assist the founder with daily logistics and scheduling to ensure smooth operations.
	Coordinate errands, appointments, and household-related needs as necessary.
	Serve as a point of contact for vendors, service providers, and studio/home maintenance issues.


Operations and Errand Support:


	Check in regularly with artisans, oversee production flow, and relay updates.
	Run errands such as picking up supplies, materials, and deliveries.
	Assist with studio and office logistics, including coordinating vendors and transport.


Weekly schedule and Structure:


	Adhere to a set weekly rhythm with minimal supervision.
	Monday&ndash;Friday: combine customer service, content management, studio support, and personal assistant duties.
	Weekly reporting to founder, highlighting completed tasks, upcoming priorities, and potential issues.


Skills and Qualification


	Exceptional organizational skills; thrives in structured environments.
	Proactive, detail-oriented, and solution-focused.
	Comfortable in both creative and operational tasks.
	Strong communication skills (English required; Yoruba helpful).
	Tech-savvy: Google Workspace, Notion, Canva, Shopify, social media platforms, iPhone photography basics.
	Ability to manage multiple responsibilities without supervision.
	Positive, calm, and professional demeanor.


Why join Oya Abeo


	Work directly with a visionary founder shaping a legacy brand.
	Blend creative work with operational impact.
	Opportunity to grow within the brand and take on increasing responsibilities.
	Be part of a supportive, culture-focused environment that values initiative and proactive problem-solving.

title: Job Openings at Workforce Group
content:
Workforce Group is a Management Consulting and Outsourcing Professional Services Firm. Following its inception in July 2004, Workforce Management Centre Limited (Workforce) has built an enviable reputation as the leading indigenous management and professional services consulting firm in Nigeria. Drawing from its Deep Domain Expertise, in the area of organizational effectiveness and employee performance, the Company is positioned to assist businesses across diverse sectors of the economy in their quest to create sustainable value for their stakeholders.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Marketing Associates (MAs) & Direct Sales Executives (DSEs)
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Proactively sell bank products to new and existing customers
	Ensure proper documentation and accuracy of all forms
	Drive account openings, card requests, and channel onboarding
	Build strong customer relationships via calls and visits
	Participate in sales drives and marketing campaigns
	Meet assigned sales targets and report performance regularly


Requirements


	For MAs: Minimum OND or HND qualification
	For DSEs: BSc / HND (Upper Credit) or equivalent
	Interested candidates should be 35 years below.


Salary
N120,000 / Month and other benefits; Full Family HMO, Pension.

Application Closing Date: 23rd December, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) National Sales Manager (B2C) – FMCG (Edible Oils)

Job Location:  Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are looking for a high-performing National Sales Manager (B2C) to drive nationwide retail growth for its flagship edible oil brands.
	If you are a proven FMCG sales leader with deep expertise in B2C channels, distributor management, and retail execution, this is your opportunity to lead a fast-growing portfolio across Nigeria.


What You’ll Lead


	Develop and execute a winning B2C sales & distribution strategy nationwide
	Grow market share across General Trade, Modern Trade & E-commerce
	Expand and manage a strong distributor, sub-distributor, and retail network
	Drive retail visibility, in-store activation, and strong trade execution
	Lead and coach a national sales force to deliver on volume and revenue targets
	Ensure efficient route-to-market operations and channel performance
	Monitor competitor activities, pricing trends, and consumer insights
	Collaborate cross-functionally with Supply Chain, Marketing, and Finance to optimize availability and drive growth


What We’re Looking For


	Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Marketing, or a related field (Minimum of Second-Class Upper); MBA is an advantage.
	7+ years of FMCG Senior Sales Leadership experience (B2C focus is a must)
	Strong track record managing distributors and retail channels
	Deep understanding of RTM models, trade marketing, and field execution
	Experience leading nationwide or large regional sales teams
	Proficiency with CRM/SFA tools and performance dashboards
	Strategic thinker with strong execution discipline.


Application Closing Date: 15th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: executivesearch@workforcegroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Factory Manager

Job Location: Costain, Lagos
Industry: Manufacturing

Job Summary


	The Factory Supervisor will oversee the daily operations of the factory to ensure efficient production and adherence to quality and safety standards.
	This role requires coordinating and managing factory staff, monitoring production output and inventory, and driving operational improvements.
	The ideal candidate will possess strong leadership skills, hands-on experience in factory or production management, and the ability to maintain smooth and compliant factory activities.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise and coordinate day-to-day factory operations to ensure efficient workflow.
	Ensure all production processes meet established quality,safety, and regulatory standards.
	Manage factory staff, including scheduling, task assignment, training, and performance monitoring.
	Monitor inventory levels, production output, and operational efficiency.
	Collaborate with management to implement process improvements and resolve operational challenges.
	Prepare routine reports on production activities, staff performance, and resource usage.


Qualifications


	HND qualification or equivalent in a relevant field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in factory supervision, production management, or related roles.
	Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
	Proactive, result-oriented, and able to thrive in a fast-paced production environment.


Salary
N350,000 - 400,000 / Month

Application Closing Date: 26th December, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

4.) Commercial Finance Manager

Job Location: Lagos City, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Telecommunication

Job Summary


	We are looking for a highly skilled Commercial Finance Manager to provide financial leadership, guide commercial decision-making, and support business profitability across our operations.
	This role requires a strategic thinker with a strong analytical mindset and deep experience in fast-paced environments.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting processes for commercial functions
	Analyze sales performance, pricing, trade spend, and market trends to support strategic growth
	Partner with Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain, and Leadership teams to drive commercial efficiency
	Evaluate financial risks, opportunities, and cost structures to support decision-making
	Provide detailed financial insights to improve margin performance and revenue optimization
	Ensure compliance with financial policies, reporting standards, and governance requirements
	Drive continuous improvement in financial controls and commercial processes


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field (MBA or professional certification is an added advantage — ACCA, ACA, CFA)
	Minimum of 7 years of experience in Commercial Finance, FP&A, or Business Finance roles
	Proven experience in FMCG or similar high-volume, data-driven industries
	Strong analytical and financial modeling skills
	Exceptional business partnering and communication abilities
	Ability to work with cross-functional teams and influence strategic decisions
	Proficiency in ERP systems and advanced Excel/financial tools.


Application Closing Date: 21st December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: mercy.oludasa@workforcegroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

	We are seeking a highly skilled Photographer and Videographer to join our team in the Security and Investigations industry.
	This role requires a professional with a keen eye for detail and the ability to capture high-quality images and videos that serve as pivotal elements in enhancing our investigations and security operations.
	The ideal candidate will not only be adept with advanced camera equipment and editing software but also possess an understanding of the security landscape, enabling them to document evidence, produce training materials, and create promotional content that accurately reflects our services.
	Your work will support our mission to provide reliable and cutting-edge security solutions to our clients. As we operate in a sensitive environment, a strong commitment to confidentiality and professionalism is essential.
	The successful candidate will be expected to collaborate closely with our investigation teams and clients to achieve desirable outcomes, ensuring that all visual content aligns with our organizational standards and client expectations.
	This is a remarkable opportunity for individuals who are passionate about visual storytelling and are ready to contribute to a dynamic team within a challenging yet rewarding sector of the security industry.


Responsibilities


	Capture high-quality photos and videos during investigations and security operations.
	Edit and enhance visual content to produce clear, professional images and videos.
	Collaborate with investigators to understand the visual requirements and nuances of specific cases.
	Maintain a well-organized library of images and video footage for easy retrieval and reference.
	Stay current with the latest trends in photography and videography technologies related to security.
	Assure compliance with legal regulations and company policies regarding privacy and confidentiality.
	Assist in producing training materials and promotional content to effectively communicate our services.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a Photographer and Videographer, preferably within the security or investigative fields.
	Proficiency in using camera equipment, lighting techniques, and editing software such as Adobe Creative Suite, canva, photoshop, etc.
	Strong understanding of the principles of photography and videography, including composition and storytelling.
	Exceptional attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality work under tight deadlines.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
	Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to interact effectively with clients and team members.
	A valid driver's license and willingness to travel to various job sites as needed.


Method of Applictaion 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their Resume and Cover Letter to: careers@pemsecurityservices.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Vacancies at Firewood Rice Nigeria
content:
At Firewood Rice Nigeria, we don’t just serve meals - we serve memories. With a deep-rooted love for authentic Nigerian dishes, we’ve built a brand that delivers comfort, flavor, and joy to our customers across Lagos. Our energetic team is the secret sauce behind our success, and we’re growing fast! If you love food, innovation, and working in a vibrant, forward-thinking environment, we want you with us.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Intercontinental Chef

Job Location: Lagos

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Oversee daily food production operations, ensuring efficient workflow and adherence to production schedules
	Monitor and manage kitchen staff, providing training and guidance to maintain high standards of food preparation
	Ensure proper use of kitchen equipment and maintenance of a clean and organized workspace
	Conduct thorough testing and refinement of recipes to ensure product consistency and quality
	Implement and enforce strict food safety and hygiene standards in compliance with industry regulations.
	Conduct regular quality checks of raw materials and finished products to ensure they meet company standards
	Manage inventory levels of ingredients and supplies, ensuring timely procurement and minimal wastage
	Prepare and manage the kitchen budget, tracking expenses and making adjustments as needed.
	Stay updated on industry trends and culinary techniques, incorporating new ideas into the production process.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 26th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: firewoodjollofcareers@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Cook

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Preparation and cooking of menu items according to established recipes and standards.
	Monitor food quality, taste, texture, and presentation to meet organizational standards.
	Ensure proper storage of raw materials and finished products, including labeling and dating.
	Minimize food wastage by following portion control guidelines.
	Follow strict hygiene practices and ensure compliance with food safety regulations.
	Work closely with other cooks and kitchen staff to meet daily production targets.
	Assist in training new staff on kitchen procedures and recipes.
	Participate in taste tests to maintain consistency in flavor and quality.
	Maintaining cleanliness and organization in the kitchen area.
	Assisting in inventory management and ordering of supplies.
	Ensuring compliance with food safety and sanitation regulations.
	Collaborating with other kitchen staff to deliver exceptional dining experiences to our customers.


Salary
N100,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 26th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: firewoodjollofcareers@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Canteen Cashier

Job Location: Lagos

Responsibilities


	Handle cash, credit, and debit transactions accurately and efficiently using the point-of-sale (POS) system.
	Take orders from customers and ensure they are entered correctly into the POS system.
	Process payments, issue receipts, or change due to customers.
	Keep the cashier area clean and organized. Ensure the front area is tidy and presentable.
	Handle customer complaints and provide assistance to ensure a positive dining experience.
	Work with the kitchen and serving staff to ensure orders are processed and delivered promptly.
	Adhere to all health and safety regulations, and company policies and procedures.
	Inform the manager of any discrepancies, customer complaints, or issues with the POS system.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications.


Salary
N60,000 - N70,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 8th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: firewoodjollofcareers@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
